1563540336_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body: You're absolutely right. I don't know how it came to be, but I can imagine all kinds of technology to replace it (I'm a software engineer).

> [stonedmagician](#comment_1_1D1tDixr8MMkJHiRiYkFVKLiJytqC5AA3k): You're absolutely right. I don't know how it came to be, but I can imagine all kinds of technology to replace it (I'm a software engineer).

I'm thinking of starting my own product that people can use to protect against most types of tracking.

> [stonedmagician](#comment_2_1D1tDixr8MMkJHiRiYkFVKLiJytqC5AA3k): I'm thinking of starting my own product that people can use to protect against most types of tracking.

As you might understand I can't clarify too much, but the product would allow you to use both the normal internet and ZeroNet anonymously (without having to even install ZeroNet yourself).

> [filips](#comment_96_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): What will this project do? How it will look like? Because for blocking JS you already have NoScript. And for blocking specific web APIs you have WebAPI Blocker

I know about those. But this will be a completely different approach and independent of which browser you choose to use.

> [petrina](#comment_7_1GFU4qAMTFnQJ7W7r98Zj2xJWq1evoN7Fz): It is possible to decouple rendering from presentation, so that a rendering browser can run on one machine and the results are presented to the user in another machine, with a second browser. There are prototypes floating around already, I expect to see it become more common place in a few years.

Yes, it will be something like this, but with much more privacy related options.

> [filips](#comment_97_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Can you share more details?

Yes, but as I plan to make money with it (I have some big bills to pay unfortunately) I can't share everything. I will answer questions though, so fire away :)

> [stonedmagician](#comment_5_1D1tDixr8MMkJHiRiYkFVKLiJytqC5AA3k): Yes, it will be something like this, but with much more privacy related options.

Like password management, one-off sessions (which get completely deleted after you close the tab of your browser) and so on.

> [stonedmagician](#comment_5_1D1tDixr8MMkJHiRiYkFVKLiJytqC5AA3k): Yes, it will be something like this, but with much more privacy related options.

Everything will be end-to-end encrypted of course.
I can't develop very fast at the moment because I fell with my electric bike and my whole body hurts a lot

> [filips](#comment_98_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): So something like headless browser which would pre-render website and display result to user on another machine? [...]

Thanks for the good info! There is no release date, I'm just working at it at my own pace. When there is something useful, I'll post an alpha / beta version here on ZeroNet.
